title: Provides that the maximum deductible allowed on policies for windstorms shall not be greater than $1,500
summary: Provides that the maximum deductible allowed in catastrophic windstorms shall not be greater than fifteen hundred dollars and shall be stated in the policy in numerical terms; also provides that deductibles shall only be applicable to losses incurred in windstorms with speeds greater than 125 miles per hour.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

       IN SENATE -- Introduced by Sen. LAVALLE -- read twice and ordered print-
         ed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Insurance

       IN  ASSEMBLY  -- Introduced by M. of A. THIELE -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation  to  windstorm  insurance
         notice regarding deductibles

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 3445 of the insurance law, as added by  chapter  44
    2  of the laws of 1998, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S  3445.  Windstorm  insurance  notice. 1. The superintendent shall by
    4  regulation establish disclosure requirements with respect to the  opera-
    5  tion  of  any  deductible  in a homeowner's insurance policy or dwelling
    6  fire personal lines policy which applies as the result of  a  windstorm.
    7  Such  regulations shall prescribe the form of a notice to be provided by
    8  an insurer to an insured. The notice shall explain in  clear  and  plain
    9  language  the  amount  of  the deductible SUBJECT TO SUBSECTION THREE OF
   10  THIS SECTION, the circumstances under which the deductible  applies  and
   11  any  other  matters  which the superintendent, in his or her discretion,
   12  shall deem necessary or appropriate.
   13    2. A CATASTROPHIC WINDSTORM DEDUCTIBLE  APPLICABLE  TO  A  HOMEOWNER'S
   14  INSURANCE  POLICY  OR  DWELLING  FIRE PERSONAL LINES POLICY SHALL NOT BE
   15  APPROVED BY THE DEPARTMENT UNLESS THE DEDUCTIBLE IS APPLICABLE  ONLY  TO
   16  LOSSES  INCURRED  IN A HURRICANE WHICH CAUSES WIND SPEEDS OF ONE HUNDRED
   17  TWENTY-FIVE MILES OR GREATER PER HOUR TO OCCUR WITHIN THE STATE.
   18    3. THE MAXIMUM DEDUCTIBLE ALLOWED SHALL NOT BE  GREATER  THAN  FIFTEEN
   19  HUNDRED DOLLARS AND SHALL BE STATED ON THE POLICY IN NUMERICAL TERMS.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1460

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the insurance law, in relation to windstorm insurance notice
regarding deductibles

PURPOSE:
To clearly define the "trigger" or conditions defining the term
catastrophic windstorm in the insurance law and place a maximum
amount deductible on windstorm damage in homeowner's policies.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Amends §3445 of the Insurance Law to clarify that catastrophic
windstorm damage deductibles shall only be applicable to hurricanes
with windspeeds of 125 miles per hour or greater and limits the
deductible to a maximum of $1500.

JUSTIFICATION:
The residents of the coastal areas of the state have been for the past
few years, subject to a homeowner's insurance market that has
vacillated and fluctuated. Without real damage experience in these
areas, insurance companies have instituted policies of huge
deductibles predicated on hurricanes with minimum windspeeds. This
bill will provide those residents with a stable market with
reasonable coverage.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009-10 S.241; S.139, 2007-08; S.716, 2005-06; S.724, 2003-04; S.2080,
2001-02; 1999-00, S.4982.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
